title: What are the biggest contributions of Spaniards in science and technology in the Philippines? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Spanish colonial era is the beginning of many establishments in the Philippines that are existing even until today. even those things that people don’t usually pay attention to because they think it has always existed like the roads and wheels. before that, the “roads” and transportation in this islands are rivers, lakes and boats. Its the beginning of formal schools, hospitals, printing presses, meteorological observatories, etc. examples: Manila Observatory -weather forecasting and earthquake research and now includes researches on seismic and geomagnetic phenomena as well as radio and solar physics, was established in 1865.San Lazaro Hospital, the oldest hospital in the Philippines , now a referral facility for communicable diseases and is one of the retained special tertiary hospital of the Department of Health was established 1578. it was first opened as a dispensary clinic in 1577 and became a hospital in 1578. It was moved to its current location in 1784.http://slh.doh.gov.ph/ Committed to a scientific culture for sustainable development
Yeah there were schools but at that time until the 1840s-60s only whites can hold a degree. That knowledge of the natives was limited to reading and writing nothing for maths and sciences.
